title.narrative: 02-03 PRIMARY PREVENTION ADOS & WOMEN

description.narrative: By end 2017, at least 60% of adolescents and women, especially the most vulnerable in the geographical areas with increased vulnerability, acquire knowledge and behaviors to reduce the risk of HIV and increase the demand and use of high-impact interventions., which contributes to Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Hiv Prevention, Hiv â€“ General, Protect, Care And Support Children And Families Affected By Hiv, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, children (including teenagers) and women especially the most vulnerable have access to and use the appropriate high- impact interventions to reduce transmission, morbidity and mortality related to HIV / AIDS and eliminate HIV transmission from mother to child.

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the Ministry of Health and the Ministry of Youth in the operationalization of the 2015-2019 strategic plan for adolescent and youth health and development. Support included the integration of the adolescent- and youth-friendly health service package into public and private health facilities. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:13/12/2017

title.narrative: Existence of age- and sex-disaggregated data on HIV testing and counselling among adolescents 15 -19 years and by sex
Existence of national household survey based data on HIV disaggregated by age and sex collected within the preceding 5 years
Adolescents 15-19 who were tested for HIV and received their results in the past 12 months
National child protection strategy or a national social protection strategy that includes elements focused on HIV available
